<topcClas>Government and political systems - Politics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p><br> <b>Problems with access to IMF AREAER</b><br> IMF AREAER is currently unavailable. We are aware of the problem and are liaising with the IMF. Unfortunately, we do not know when this problem will be rectified.  Apologies for the inconvenience.<br> <br> The <i>International Monetary Fund (IMF) Annual Report on Exchange Arrangements and Exchange Restrictions (AREAER) </i> database tracks exchange and trade arrangements for all IMF member countries.<br> <br> This unique database is updated yearly based mostly on information from country authorities. The database also provides information on different types of capital controls used by countries, restrictions on current international payments and transfers, arrangements for payments and receipts, procedures for resident and non-resident accounts, exchange rate arrangements, and the operation of foreign exchange markets. It also includes measures implemented in the financial sector, including prudential measures. <br> <br> The IMF has published the AREAER annually since 1950.  <a class="external" href=" http://imf-areaer.mimas.ac.uk" title="AREAER Online">AREAER Online</a>, accessible at the UK Data Service  provides direct access to the data used to create the yearly reports covering the period from 1999 through 2010. The data can be searched across years, countries and specific categories.<br> <br> This database was first provided by the UK Data Service in December 2013 and includes the IMF AREAER <a class="external" href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/use-data/guides/dataset/areaer.aspx" title="IMF AREAER dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b>   The bibliographic citation for the database is: International Monetary Fund (<i>{YYYY}</i>): Annual Report on Exchange Arrangements and Exchange Restrictions (<i>{date/edition of dataset}</i>).  Mimas, University of Manchester.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The database covers:<ul><li>finance</li><li>economics</li><li>exchange rates </li><li>exchange restrictions</li><li>monetary policy</li><li>capital controls</li><li>trade</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate>These data run from 1999 to the present and are updated annually.</collDate>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>The database covers 190 countries: Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, Angola, Antigua, Argentina, Armenia, Aruba, Australia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Bahamas, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Barbados, Belarus, Belgium, Belize, Benin, Bhutan, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Botswana, Brazil, Brunei, Bulgaria, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Cape Verde, Central African Republic, Chad, Chile, China, Colombia, Comoros, Congo Democratic Republic, Congo Republic of, Costa Rica, Cote d'Ivoire, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Djibouti, Dominica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, Estonia, Ethiopia, Fiji, Finland, France, Gabon, Gambia, Georgia, Germany, Ghana, Greece, Grenada, Guatemala, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Guyana, Haiti, Honduras, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Jamaica, Japan, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kenya, Kiribati, Korea, Kosovo, Kuwait, Kyrgyzstan, People's Democratic Republic of Lao, Latvia, Lebanon, Lesotho, Liberia, Libya, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macedonia, Madagascar, Malawi, Malaysia, Maldives,
